meanings.definition: A person who is old-fashioned or resistant to change.
meanings.sent1: The fogy always insists on using a typewriter instead of a computer.
meanings.sent2: My grandpa is a fogy when it comes to technology.
meanings.sent3: The fogy at the office still wears a bowler hat to work.
meanings.sent4: In a world of smartphones, he was a fogy clinging to his flip phone.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fogy in his vintage suit was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To become old-fashioned or out of date.
meanings.sent1: The fashion trend quickly fogyed and was no longer popular.
meanings.sent2: Her once favorite song fogyed into obscurity over time.
meanings.sent3: The technology fogyed as newer models were released.
meanings.sent4: His ideas fogyed as the world moved forward without him.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting slowly fogyed with age.
